bibl.title: From 'G' to 'PG-13'. The Passion of Sostratos in Menander's Dyskolos.
bibl.note: Instead of employing sexual terminology explicitly like Aristophanes, Menander made greater use of double-entendres like his contemporaries, so that he can be both obscene and polite at once. Sostratos's soliloquy in Dyskolos 522-545 show-cases such suggestive verbal humor.
bibl.seg: KRAUSS Amanda and Jess MINER, From 'G' to 'PG-13'. The Passion of Sostratos in Menander's Dyskolos.

Instead of employing sexual terminology explicitly like Aristophanes, Menander made greater use of double-entendres like his contemporaries, so that he can be both obscene and polite at once. Sostratos's soliloquy in Dyskolos 522-545 show-cases such suggestive verbal humor.
